To start with PHP you need to have a web server that supports PHP.  You can either use a free web host, or run your own server.  If you want to run your own web server on windows just download <a href="http://www.apachefriends.org/en/xampp-windows.html">XAMPP</a>.  Once you have that downloaded and installed, all you do is save your PHP scripts in the htdocs folder (Same for all web servers) then navigate (in a web browser) to <a href="http://localhost/">http://localhost/</a>.  Or if you are useing a free web host such as <a href="http://awardspace.com">http://awardspace.com</a> just upload the php scripts to the root directory (htdocs)

To write a PHP script you just open up a text editor (e.g Notepad, gedit etc) and write in the PHP script and save as filename<strong>.php</strong> make sure that it ends in dot ph.

Now to make sure that the server knows that it is a PHP script you musty have <strong><?php</strong> at the beginning and <strong>?></strong> at the end.

So we will start with a basic Hello world! example. Write don't copy this into your hello.php file:
<pre>
<?php

echo "Hello World!";</pre>
<pre>?></pre>
There you go a very simple PHP scrip.

Hope this helped, Pete Out

(Any Questions Just Ask)
